definition: road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: Design of multi-channel audio retrieval system based on melody;
sentences.chinese: 介紹了一種多聲道超聲氣體流量計的電路設計。

sentences.english: IMAX six-channel super audio system includes subwoofer channel.
sentences.chinese: IMAX六聲道超級音響系統包含有超低音頻道。

sentences.english: Two-axis underwater channel often exists in deep ocean.
sentences.chinese: 雙軸聲道常出現於大洋中。

sentences.english: This paper presents the electrocircuit design of a multi-path ultrasonic gas flowmeter.
sentences.chinese: 介紹了一種多聲道超聲氣體流量計的電路設計。

sentences.english: The left and right channels are combined to one digital data string via a multiplexor .
sentences.chinese: 通過多路轉換器將左右聲道合成一個聲道。

sentences.english: This port connects to the side speakers in an 8-channel audio configuration.
sentences.chinese: 該端口連接到位於兩邊的擴音器在8聲道音頻配置。

sentences.english: A monaural presentation has to be used to yield a clear effect.
sentences.chinese: 一個單聲道的一定要有清晰的效果。

sentences.english: With Mono you can develop and run .
sentences.chinese: 與單聲道，您可以開發和運行。

sentences.english: Determines what each channel is connected to.
sentences.chinese: 決定每一個聲道連接至何處。

sentences.english: You can use it to record, edit and mix multi-track audio.
sentences.chinese: 你可以使用它來錄製，編輯和混合多聲道音頻。

sentences.english: Multichannel signals automatically will be down mixed to two analog channels for use in the remote zone;
sentences.chinese: 多聲道信號將自動混合成兩個模擬聲道用於遠程區。

definition: gnashing one's teeth (idiom); displaying extreme anger/fuming with rage between gritted teeth
to wave one's hand/to gesture with one's hand (beckoning, waving good-bye etc)/to swing one's arms
in a low voice/(speak) in whispers
to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
